title: Power to avoid transfers
context: ยง560:3-710 Power to avoid transfers. The property liable for the payment of unsecured debts of a decedent includes all property transferred by the decedent by any means which is in law void or voidable as against the decedent&rsquo;s creditors, and subject to prior liens, the right to recover this property, so far as necessary for the payment of unsecured debts of the decedent, is exclusively in the personal representative. [L 1996, c 288, pt of ยง1]
